newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK property stocks slammed by interest rate fears.
newsitem.headline: HK property stocks slammed by interest rate fears.

text.p: Property stocks tumbled on Friday as interest rate concerns shook the market following an overnight fall in the U.S. long bond yield ahead of the release of November U.S. jobs data later on Friday, brokers said.
"I think that triggered a bit of profit-taking ahead of long holidays...everyone wants to enjoy the (Christmas) turkey," said Louis Tse, executive director of Standard Capital Brokerage said.
The Hang Seng Properties sub-index fell 1,014, or 3.79 percent, to 25,729.
Brokers said investors were also concerned about possible government intervention to dampen a strong rise in prices in the property market.
"Some people are proposing to curb property speculation," said Frederick Tsang, head of research at PrimeEast Securities.
Shares of Cheung Kong Holdings Ltd fell HK$3.25 to HK$66.25 in late morning, Sun Hung Kai Properties Ltd fell HK$3.25 to HK$94.75, and New World Development Co Ltd was down HK$2.30 to HK$48.70.
Brokers said investors were also taking profits on finance stocks.
HSBC Holdings Plc fell HK$5.00 to HK$157.50 and Hang Seng Bank Ltd was down HK$2.50 to HK$90.00.
